page.title: 05CRAIGLEITH QUARRY,EDINBURGH.
page.content:
A hundred years ago there was a working quarry at Craigleith.Hard good quality sandstone of several different shades was mined here. The quarry was two hundred feet deep and part of the floor of the quarry was filled with deep water. Horses and carts were used to haul the stones up the steep track out of the quarry.
When shaped by the masons the stones were transported from the quarry by rail,either to Leith dock or to town. Some was used to build the{New Town.} Two large pillars of Edinburgh University are from the quarry and even some parts of Buckingham Palace are faced with Craigleith stone.The supply of sandstone gradually ran out and the quarry has now been filled in.
